intro: Asparagus flavicaulis subsp. setulosus, commonly known as the silky asparagus, is a perennial plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, bright green leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer, followed by small, red berries. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a container plant. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is often cultivated in Mediterranean climates.
